verses.verse: Then Moses<WH4872> and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> sang<WH7891> this song<WH7892> to Yahweh,<WH3068> and said,<WH559> <WH559> "I will sing<WH7891> to Yahweh,<WH3068> for he has triumphed<WH1342> gloriously.<WH1342> The horse<WH5483> and his rider<WH7392> he has thrown<WH7411> into the sea.<WH3220>

Yah<WH3050> is my strength<WH5797> and song.<WH2176> He<WH2088> has become my salvation.<WH3444> This<WH2088> is my God,<WH410> and I will praise him;<WH1> my father's God,<WH430> and I will exalt him.<WH7311>
Yahweh<WH3068> is a man<WH376> of war.<WH4421> Yahweh<WH3068> is his name.<WH8034>
He has cast<WH3384> Pharaoh<WH6547>'s chariots<WH4818> and his army<WH2428> into the sea.<WH3220> His chosen<WH4005> captains<WH7991> are sunk<WH2883> in the Red<WH5488> Sea.<WH3220>
The deeps<WH8415> cover<WH3680> them.<WH3381> They went down into the depths<WH4688> like<WH3644> a stone.<WH68>
Your right hand,<WH3225> Yahweh,<WH3068> is glorious<WH142> in power.<WH3581> Your right hand,<WH3225> Yahweh,<WH3068> dashes the enemy<WH341> in pieces.<WH7492>

In the greatness<WH7230> of your excellency,<WH1347> you overthrow<WH2040> those who rise up against<WH6965> you.<WH7971> You send forth your wrath.<WH2740> It consumes<WH398> them as stubble.<WH7179>

With the blast<WH7307> of your nostrils,<WH639> the waters<WH4325> were piled<WH6192> up.<WH5140> The floods stood upright<WH5324> as a heap.<WH5067> The deeps<WH8415> were congealed<WH7087> in the heart<WH3820> of the sea.<WH3220>

The enemy<WH341> said,<WH559> <WH7291> 'I will pursue. I will overtake.<WH5381> I will divide<WH2505> the spoil.<WH7998> My desire<WH5315> shall be satisfied<WH4390> on them.<WH7324> I will draw my sword,<WH2719> my hand<WH3027> shall destroy them.<WH3423>'
You blew<WH5398> with your wind.<WH7307> The sea<WH3220> covered<WH3680> them.<WH6749> They sank like lead<WH5777> in the mighty<WH117> waters.<WH4325>
Who is like you,<WH3068> Yahweh, among the gods?<WH410> Who is like you,<WH142> glorious in holiness,<WH6944> fearful<WH3372> in praises,<WH8416> doing<WH6213> wonders?<WH6382>
You stretched out<WH5186> your right hand.<WH3225> The earth<WH776> swallowed them.<WH1104>

"You,<WH2617> in your loving kindness, have led<WH5148> the people<WH5971> that<WH2098> you have redeemed.<WH1350> You have guided<WH5095> them in your strength<WH5797> to your holy<WH6944> habitation.<WH5116>
The peoples<WH5971> have heard.<WH8085> They tremble.<WH7264> Pangs<WH2427> have taken hold<WH270> on the inhabitants<WH3427> of Philistia.<WH6429>

Then<WH227> the chiefs<WH441> of Edom<WH123> were dismayed.<WH926> Trembling<WH7461> takes hold<WH270> of the mighty men<WH352> of Moab.<WH4124> All the inhabitants<WH3427> of Canaan<WH3667> are melted away.<WH4127>

Terror<WH367> and dread<WH6343> falls<WH5307> on them.<WH1419> By the greatness of your arm<WH2220> they are as still<WH1826> as a stone<WH68>â€” until your people<WH5971> pass over,<WH5674> Yahweh,<WH3068> until the people<WH5971> pass over<WH5674> who<WH2098> you have purchased.<WH7069>

You shall bring<WH935> them in,<WH5193> and plant them in the mountain<WH2022> of your inheritance,<WH5159> the place,<WH4349> Yahweh,<WH3068> which you have made<WH6466> for yourself to dwell in;<WH3427> the sanctuary,<WH4720> Lord,<WH136> which your hands<WH3027> have established.<WH3559>
Yahweh<WH3068> shall reign<WH4427> forever<WH5703> and ever.<WH5769>"

For the horses<WH5483> of Pharaoh<WH6547> went in<WH935> with his chariots<WH7393> and with his horsemen<WH6571> into the sea,<WH3220> and Yahweh<WH3068> brought back<WH7725> the waters<WH4325> of the sea<WH3220> on them;<WH1121> but the children of Israel<WH3478> walked<WH1980> on dry<WH3004> land in the midst<WH8432> of the sea.<WH3220>

Miriam<WH4813> the prophetess,<WH5031> the sister<WH269> of Aaron,<WH175> took<WH3947> a tambourine<WH8596> in her hand;<WH3027> and all the women<WH802> went out<WH3318> after<WH310> her with tambourines<WH8596> and with dances.<WH4246>

Miriam<WH4813> answered<WH6030> them,<WH7891> "Sing to Yahweh,<WH3068> for he has triumphed<WH1342> gloriously.<WH1342> The horse<WH5483> and his rider<WH7392> he has thrown<WH7411> into the sea.<WH3220>"

Moses<WH4872> led Israel<WH3478> onward<WH5265> from the Red<WH5488> Sea,<WH3220> and they went out<WH3318> into the wilderness<WH4057> of Shur;<WH7793> and they went<WH3212> three<WH7969> days<WH3117> in the wilderness,<WH4057> and found<WH4672> no water.<WH4325>

When they came<WH935> to Marah,<WH4785> they couldn't<WH3201> drink<WH8354> from the waters<WH4325> of Marah,<WH4785> for they were bitter.<WH4751> Therefore its name<WH8034> was called<WH7121> Marah.<WH4785>
The people<WH5971> murmured<WH3885> against Moses,<WH4872> saying,<WH559> "What shall we drink?<WH8354>"

Then he cried<WH6817> to Yahweh.<WH3068> Yahweh<WH3068> showed<WH3384> him a tree,<WH6086> and he threw<WH7993> it into the waters,<WH4325> and the waters<WH4325> were made sweet.<WH4985> There he made<WH7760> a statute<WH2706> and an ordinance<WH4941> for them,<WH5254> and there he tested them;

and he said,<WH559> "If you will diligently<WH8085> listen<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of Yahweh<WH3068> your God,<WH430> and will do<WH6213> that which is right<WH3477> in his eyes,<WH238> and will pay attention to his commandments,<WH4687> and keep<WH8104> all his statutes,<WH2706> I will put<WH7760> none of the diseases<WH4245> on you,<WH7760> which I have put on the Egyptians;<WH4714> for I am Yahweh<WH3068> who heals you.<WH7495>"
They came<WH935> to Elim,<WH362> where there were twelve<WH8147> springs<WH5869> of water,<WH4325> and seventy<WH7657> palm trees:<WH8558> and they encamped<WH2583> there by the waters.<WH4325>
